content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as the central storage depot.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-3.0, y=19.0) used for smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-4.0, y=21.0) employed for copper smelting into copper plates (current furnace output: {"copper-plate": 6}).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System)
Consists of the following entities:
- Lab at position (x=-7.5, y=18.5) configured for automation research.
- Boiler at position (x=-5.5, y=24.0) that was recently refueled but remains flagged with fuel issues.
- Generator (Steam Engine) at position (x=-0.5, y=24.5) which, after attempted connection to the new pole, currently shows an energy level of 0.0 and warnings: ["not connected to power network", "no input liquid", "no fluid present in connections"].
- Offshore Pump at position (x=-7.5, y=25.5) operating normally.
- Electricity Group comprising small electric poles at positions (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
- Pipe Groups forming the fluid network:
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=4664) at position (x=-10.5, y=16.5) – EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=4665) at position (x=-12.5, y=18.5) – EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=4667) at position (x=-8.5, y=20.5) – FULL_OUTPUT (fluid: water).
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=4669) at position (x=-2.5, y=21.5) – EMPTY.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- AssemblingMachine1 at position (x=1.5, y=19.5) operating the copper-cable recipe with an energy level of 0.0 and warnings: ["not receiving electricity", "cannot create copper-cable due to missing resources: copper-plate (1)"].
- Burner Inserter at position (x=1.5, y=17.5) refueled with coal (fuel inventory includes coal: 9) and awaiting source items.
- Input Chest at position (x=1.5, y=16.5) designated to receive copper plates.
- Output Chest at position (x=1.5, y=21.5) for dispatching copper-cable.
- Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at position (x=-5.5, y=21.5) holding copper plates.
Note: Multiple attempts have been made to automate copper plate delivery from the copper smelting furnace (which computes an effective drop at (x=-4.0, y=20.0)), but transport belt connections have repeatedly failed due to entity type incompatibilities.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fuel and Resource Management:
   - Ensure sufficient coal and copper plates are available before initiating transfers; confirm that smelting furnaces are outputting the expected resources.

• Entity Placement & Collision Avoidance:
   - Verify target positions are unoccupied before placing entities. For instance, avoid placing an inserter where one already exists (as occurred with the burner inserter near (x=1.5, y=16.5)).

• API and Attribute Usage:
   - Use accurate entity attribute names. For example, reference “StoneFurnace” instead of “Furnace” and ensure attributes like drop_position are supported.
   - Confirm that all necessary variables (e.g., those used for defining target inserters) are properly defined prior to execution.

• Transport Belt and Inserter Connection:
   - Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a chest. When automating item delivery, use an inserter as the intermediary target.
   - Recheck computed drop positions to ensure compatibility with the target entity type before establishing connections.

• Power Connectivity:
   - Reassess power network wiring and connection points. Secure stable power links between generators, poles, and associated components to prevent energy drop-offs.

• Supply Chain Coordination:
   - Synchronize automated and manual transfers to avoid errors such as attempting to insert items that are not present in the inventory.
